summary: The Performing Artist Tax Parity Act of 2025 amends the Internal Revenue Code to increase the adjusted gross income limitation for above-the-line deductions of expenses for performing artists. It introduces a phaseout based on income exceeding $100,000 ($200,000 for joint returns), with cost-of-living adjustments. The bill also clarifies that commissions paid to managers and agents are deductible and increases the threshold for determining nominal employers, with corresponding cost-of-living adjustments. The changes apply to tax years starting after December 31, 2024.
